bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Blossom Reed, February 17, 1948

div1.p: Hench apologizes for missing Emilie Lawrence Reed's birthday. He hopes that Blossom Reed will attend the Reed memorial evening at the International Congress on Tropical Medicine, as well as the unveiling of the Walter Reed bust in New York.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Blossom Reed, February 17, 1948
div1.opener:
February 17, 1948
Mrs. Blossom Reed
Blue Ridge Summit
Pennsylvania
My dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
I am greatly disgusted with myself. When Mary and I visited you and
your mother in November, I made a note of your mother's forthcoming 92nd birth-
day in my little pocket notebook for 1947. To my regret, I did not copy this
note into my 1948 notebook as I had planned to do and I missed completely the
opportunity of sending her a birthday greeting on her 92nd birthday.

It annoys me very much because I have thought about it with pleasure
several times and then as the time approached I got very busy with other things
and it slipped my mind entirely. Please do give her our love. It was so nice
for us to see you both again. Thank you very much indeed for sending me the
clipping.

I do hope that we will see you in Washington in May at the time of
the Walter Reed memorial evening before the International Congress on Tropical
Medicine. I am sure you will be receiving an invitation from those who are
running the Congress, as I have sent them your name and address. I understand
that the bust of your father will be unveiled in New York on May 20. I do hope
that you can be there also.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
